Dear BRANDON HANNAH:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact the area
manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but
not limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Type Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Allegation On 5/29/23, staff member choked youth and youth has resulting
red marks on their neck and scratches on their arm. Youth was
transported to the hospital for an exam.
Investigation On 06/02/2023 video footage from the incident was reviewed.
Video begins with Youth A in his personal aisle with Supervisor 1
talking with him. Staff 1 and Staff 2 are seen in the unit.
Supervisor 1 is seen pushing Youth A back with one arm as he
tries to walk out of the area. Youth A then steps closer to the
personal area of Supervisor 1 and lunges toward him. Supervisor
1 is seen extending his arm to try to get Youth A away from him.
Staff 2 attempts to separate them, but Supervisor 1 walks with
them and Youth A pushes Supervisor 1 again. Supervisor 1 is
then seen grabbing Youth A and pushes him toward his bed
where he falls over the foot of the bed. Supervisor 1 and Staff 2
place Youth A into a standing restraint. Youth A is attempting to
get out of the restraint and continues to struggle with the staff.
Three other youth are observed to be watching the restraint and
Staff 1 is seen walking toward the area. Youth A is seen kicking
the staff that have him in standing restraint and seems to be
yelling things at Supervisor 1. Youth B and Youth C are seen
getting close to the restraint and are moving shoes that have
been kicked off out of the way. Supervisor 1 is seen pinning
Youth A against the wall with his forearm after Youth A was
continuously kicking at him. Staff 1 is seen walking out of the unit
but returns shortly. Supervisor 1 is seen grabbing Youth A away
from Staff 2 by his shirt and moves Youth A to an area where he
cannot be seen by the camera. Youth B and Youth C are seen
running over to the area and attempting to pull the shirt of
Supervisor 1. Staff 1 and Staff 2 are seen trying to keep Youth B
and Youth C back. Staff 2 attempts to assist Supervisor 1, but it
is unclear what is occurring due to them being in a blind spot of
the camera. Youth B and Youth C present as agitated as they
continue to attempt to get to the area where Youth A and
2

Supervisor 1 are. Staff 2 continues his efforts to redirect Youth B
and Youth C.
On 06/02/2023 an in-person meeting was held with the Chief
Administrator (CA) at Clarence Fischer Center (CFC). The
DHHS specialist was also present. The unit where the incident
occurred was viewed. CA acknowledged that they have
discovered that there is a blind spot area in the unit and it will be
addressed by blocking that area off. Staff 2 and Staff 3 were
confirmed as being in the unit at the time of the incident. CA
advised that he had viewed the video and the techniques used by
Supervisor 1 were not appropriate and not what is taught in CPI.
On 06/02/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Youth D at
CFC. The DHHS specialist and Vassar PD was present. Youth
D confirmed that he was placed in Unit 4 at the time of the
incident. It should be noted that Youth D is difficult to understand
due to his speech impediment. Youth D reported he saw
Supervisor 1 put Youth A in a headlock and was chocking him.
Youth D described Supervisor 1 putting his left hand up to Youth
A’s throat. Youth D stated he left the unit to try to find another
supervisor to assist. Youth D denied hearing Supervisor 1 say
anything to Youth A.
On 06/02/2023 an in-person interview is held with Youth B at
CFC. The DHHS specialist and Vassar PD was present. Youth
B reported Youth A was placed in a restraint, but he was not sure
why. He confirmed Supervisor 1, Staff 1 and Staff 2 were the
staff in the unit. He reported Youth A was at one point restrained
against the wall and Youth A was repeatedly kicking Supervisor
1. Youth B does not recall that Supervisor 1 was saying anything
to Youth A, but stated Youth A was crying and telling staff to let
him go. Youth B reported Supervisor 1 pulled Youth A into the
corner and held his forearm against Youth A’s neck. Youth B
stated he then attempted to get Supervisor 1 off of Youth A
because he was choking him. He recalled Youth A was making a
choking sound as Supervisor 1 held his arm against his neck.
Youth B reported Youth A was pulled away from Supervisor 1 by
Staff 1 and Staff 2 and they were trying to keep him calm. Youth
B reported he was not sure what else happened, as he walked
out of the unit. Youth B reported this is the first time he has seen
Supervisor 1 do something like this, however stated Supervisor 1
does threaten the youth a lot. Youth B reported when he left the
unit, he walked to another building on campus. He denied staff
followed him and was not sure if they were even aware that he
3

left. He reported as he was walking back to the unit, Supervisor
2 found him and brought him back to CFC.
On 06/02/2023 an in-person interview was held with Supervisor 2
at CFC. The DHHS specialist and Vassar PD were also present.
Supervisor 2 reported working morning shift on 5/29/2023 but
returned to the facility later that day as she knew assistance was
needed. She reported arriving on site and going to Unit 4. She
reported it was then that she was advised of allegations against
Supervisor 1. She reported moving Supervisor 1 to another unit,
discussing the concerns with the Clinical Director and advising
staff to take Youth A to the hospital for an evaluation. Supervisor
2 reported it was later decided to send Supervisor 1 home for the
night. Supervisor 2 reported all the youth placed in Unit 4 stated
Supervisor 1 choked Youth A. Supervisor 2 also reported talking
to Supervisor 1 and he never indicated that he choked Youth A.
She stated Supervisor 1 told her Youth A was upset because he
wanted to go outside and was told no. She further reported
Supervisor 1 stated Youth A became aggressive, so he was
placed in a restraint, and he was kicking staff while in the
restraint. Supervisor 2 confirmed she has heard complaints from
youth about Supervisor 1. She stated the complaints were
mainly about his communication, attitude, and facial expressions.
She denied any staff have complained about Supervisor 1.
Supervisor 2 also reported when she arrived on site, she thought
Youth B was in the unit with everyone else, but found out he was
not when it was reported he walked off site. She found him
walking back from Camp 1 with a bamboo stick and brought him
back to CFC.
On 06/02/2023 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 2
at CFC. The DHHS specialist and Vassar PD was also present.
Staff 2 confirmed he is a youth care worker and has been
employed with the agency for about seven years. He recalled
that upon his arrival to work, Youth A was assessed as “off focus”
and he had been working to “build him back up”. He reported
Youth A wanted to go outside and was upset because he could
not. After dinner Staff 2 reported Youth A began throwing chairs
and engaging in other negative behavior to seek attention. Staff
2 confirmed Staff 1 was the other staff present in the unit with
him. He reported they called a supervisor for assistance and
Supervisor 1 arrived. Supervisor 1 asked Youth A to remain by
his bed and the youth kept coming closer and closer to
Supervisor 1 and per Staff 2, Supervisor 1 extended his arm in an
attempt to keep Youth A at bay. Staff 2 reported Youth A hit the
arm of Supervisor 1 and then “flinched” at him as if he was going
4

to hit him. Youth A was placed in a standing hold by Staff 2 and
Supervisor 1. He described Youth A as “kicking and bouncing his
body around”. Staff 2 reported he swapped out with Staff 1 so
that he could try to control the other youth in the unit. They had
become upset and were trying to fight Supervisor 1. Staff 2
denied knowing why the youth were upset with Supervisor 1.
Staff 2 denied seeing Supervisor 1 choke Youth A or place his
arms near Youth A’s neck. Staff 2 indicated he was facing the
other direction most of the time. He reported everything
happened so quick and he felt Youth A was targeting Supervisor
1. Staff 2 reported at the end of all of the events, Youth B and
Youth C said Supervisor 1 choked Youth A. Staff 2 denied
knowing why the restraint was moved near the corner and out of
the view of the camera. Staff 2 reported he assisted with the
transport of Youth A to the hospital later that evening. He denied
seeing any injuries on Youth A, but reported Youth A told him
Supervisor 1 “choked” him. Staff 2 had no direct knowledge of
Youth B leaving the unit and walking over to Camp 1.
On 06/02/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 1 at
CFC. The DHHS specialist and Vassar PD were also present.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was upset because he was not able to
go outside. She stated Youth A was consistently doing things to
get staff attention. Staff 1 stated they called for supervisor
assistance and Supervisor 1 showed up. She reported Youth A
was throwing cones and Supervisor 1 instructed him to return to
his personal aisle and Youth A refused. Staff 1 recalled Youth A
attempted to chest bump Supervisor 1 and swung on him. Youth
A was placed in a standing restraint. Youth A was yelling “help
me” and Staff 1 stated she believed this is why Youth B and
Youth C were trying to intervene. Staff 1 stated after the
restraint, Youth A went to the restroom and came out stating he
had scratches on his arm and was going to get everyone fired.
After reviewing the video footage, Staff 1 confirmed Supervisor 1
was holding Youth A by himself at one point. She denied ever
seeing hands or arms of Supervisor around or near the neck of
Youth A. She also denied knowing why the restraint moved to
underneath the camera and out of the view of the camera. Staff
1 stated Youth B reported seeing Supervisor 1 choke Youth A.
Staff 1 confirmed Youth B had walked out of the building and was
picked up by staff coming into work.
On 06/02/2023 an in-person interview was held with Supervisor 1
at CFC. The DHHS specialist and Vassar PD was also present.
Supervisor 1 reported he responded to a page for assistance in
the unit. Upon arrival, he stated Youth A was throwing things
5

and not responding to redirection. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A
became aggressive and was trying to push him and threatening
to hit him. Youth A was initially placed in a standing hold by
Supervisor 1 and Staff 2 and Staff 1 later swapped out with Staff
2. Supervisor 1 reported the restraint began near Youth A’s bed,
but they were struggling because Youth A continued to kick staff.
Once Youth A was calm, he was released from the restraint.
Supervisor 1 stated Youth A said that he was choked. Youth B
and Youth C also reported that Supervisor 1 had choked the
youth. Supervisor 1 reported the restraint moved to the corner as
this is where Youth A was moving them too. Supervisor 1 denied
choking Youth A and denied utilizing any type of physical
discipline (i.e hitting, kicking, etc.) with him.
On 06/22/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Youth A at
CFC. Youth A had to come in from recreation activity outside of
the unit. Attempts to discuss the incident with Youth A was
unsuccessful. He indicated he did not want to discuss the
incident. Youth A stated he did not want to talk about it, because
he has been abused before. He further stated “I already talked
about this with DHHS and the police about what happened with
me and Supervisor 1, I don’t want to talk about it.
On 06/22/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Youth C at
CFC. Youth C reported he remembered being in the unit and
seeing Supervisor 1 choke Youth A. He stated that he does not
know why Youth A was restrained but knows that he was. Youth
C went on to indicate he does not believe the restraint was done
the correct way. Youth C stated he thinks Supervisor 1 choked
Youth A. He stated he saw Supervisor 1 put his arm under the
neck of Youth A. He reported there were two other staff present,
but he cannot recall their names.
On 06/22/2023 an in-person meeting was held with the
complainant. No additional concerns were provided.
On 06/22/2023 a telephone conversation occurred with DHHS
specialist. She advised that she and Law enforcement had
interviewed Youth A and he reported that he was choked by
Supervisor 1.
On 06/29/2023 a DHHS dispositional meeting was held. The
allegations were discussed. The DHHS specialist advised that
findings of abuse and/or neglect were made, and Staff 1 will have
a confirmed case.
6

Documents Reviewed
Incident Report for 5/29/2023 involving Youth A: The incident
report is dated 5/29/2023 at 7:20 p.m. It noted that Youth A was
placed in a standing restraint by staff and supervisor due to
aggressive behavior. Specifically, it indicated that Youth A
became unfocused because he wanted to go outside, became
impatient and began seeking attention by causing the
environment to become unsafe via throwing chairs, banging
traffic cones against things and banging his ankle brace against
things in the unit. A supervisor was called to calm down the
issue, however Youth A remained aggressive and began hitting
at the supervisor and making verbal threats. If was further
reported that Youth A remained aggressive, even when in the
restraint causing staff to accidently step on his foot. The body
figure map documents that staff identified red marks on the neck
of Youth A, scratches on both arms and bleeding to his toe.
Written Statements of Staff:
Staff 2 provided a written statement. In summary, it indicated
Youth A became unfocused because he wanted to go outside.
When he was told he couldn't go outside, he then began attention
seeking by making the environment unsafe to his staff and other
clients by throwing chairs and banging items against things in the
unit. A supervisor was called for assistance and Youth A
continued his aggressive and inappropriate behavior. Youth A
was making threats toward Supervisor 1 and was seeming to
want to provoke Supervisor 1. Youth A was placed in a standing
restraint by staff and supervisor. The written statement of Staff 2
was consistent with his interview.
Staff 1’s written statement, in summary, noted the following:
"Youth A was upset because he couldn't go outside. He began to
state to staff that he was going to go outside or tear this bitch up.
Staff tried to redirect Youth A without success. He became
disruptive to the program by picking up and throwing chairs,
grabbing the top of mop bucket, swinging it around trying to hit
objects with it. A supervisor was contacted for assistance and
Youth A continued to be aggressive and make threats and was
placed in a restraint”.
It should be noted there was no written statement submitted by
Supervisor 1.
Medical Records of Youth A: He was seen at Covenant
Hospital on 5/29/2023. The note by Doctor indicated that the
youth was wearing a boot and had scratches on his forearm. It
7

was also noted a 5/29/23 contact between DHHS specialist and
Doctor that a follow up was completed and Doctor reported Youth
A might have a small fracture, but he was awaiting review of the
radiology report. Doctor was asked if the marks on the neck of
Youth A were consistent with choking, and he reported not
seeing the marks. DHHS specialist showed Doctor pictures on
her telephone, and he responded and advised that they marks
were small abrasions.
Disciplinary file of Supervisor 1: (6/8/23) – HR Liaison advised
that Supervisor 1 had discipline in his file. He was written up in
October 2022 for not properly tracking medication and in April
2023 for failing to communicate regarding staff coverage in a unit.
Supervisor 1 successfully completed CPI training as evidenced
by certificate of completion in his HR file.
It was also confirmed, via review of the certificate of completion in
the HR file, that Staff 1 and Staff 2 successfully completed CPI
training. Staff 1 completed training on 04/24/2023 and Staff 2
attended on 04/14/2023.
CPI manual and behavior management policy were reviewed
for approved techniques.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, there was evidence to
support violation of licensing rule 400.4158 1aii. Youth A, Youth
B, Youth C and Youth D all reported Supervisor 1 choked Youth
A. Additionally, video footage showed Supervisor 1 push Youth
A, pin Youth A to the wall with his forearm, and grab Youth A by
his shirt to move him to location that was unable to be seen by
camera view.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR # 2023C0000074, CAP Approved 02/24/2023
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 – Criminal History Check, subject to
Section requirements; Staff Qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Type Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Allegation Staff member lacks the ability to perform job duties.
Investigation During a conference call on 06/29/2023, DHHS specialist
reported there was a preponderance of evidence and Supervisor
1 will have a confirmed case.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as one staff member has a
confirmed case.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Based on the findings of this investigation, in conjunction with the recommendation of
SIR 2023C0000295 a First Provisional license is recommended upon receipt on an
acceptable corrective action plan.
